dt: {bc}one having care or charge of something {bc}{sx|guardian||}, {sx|keeper||}
{bc}the governor of a town, district, or fortress
{bc}a member of the governing body of a guild
{bc}an official charged with special supervisory duties or with the enforcement of specified laws or regulations
{bc}an official in charge of the operation of a prison
{bc}any of various British officials having designated administrative functions
{bc}one of two ranking lay officers of an Episcopal parish
{bc}any of various British college officials whose duties range from the administration of academic matters to the supervision of student discipline

et: Middle English {it}wardein{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}wardein, gardein{/it}, from {it}warder{/it} to guard
shortdef: one having care or charge of something : guardian, keeper
the governor of a town, district, or fortress
